issues.description: The addGuestStudents method in the template repository has an extra parameter (boolean validateInput) compared to what is specified in the problem statement and implemented in the solution repository. This discrepancy could confuse students, as the problem statement and UML diagram specify a method with only one integer parameter, but the template provides a signature that includes an additional boolean, potentially leading students to believe they must incorporate validation logic that isn't part of the intended design.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the extra boolean parameter from the addGuestStudents method in the template repository to align its signature with the problem statement and solution, ensuring students start with a method that matches the intended design without unintended additions.

issues.description: The addGuestStudents method in the template repository includes an extra parameter 'validateInput' not specified in the problem statement, potentially confusing students about the required method signature and leading to incorrect implementations that incorporate unintended validation logic.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template repository's addGuestStudents method to match the problem statement by removing the extra 'boolean validateInput' parameter, ensuring the method signature is consistent with one integer parameter only.
